website_summaries.verdict: Despite this gadget's clear potential, there are still too many performance kinks for us to recommend it outright.
pros: The Quirky Spotter Multipurpose Sensor is a great idea with scores of potential household uses
The free Wink app that you'll use to control it features an intelligent, elegant design, and we love that it's now compatible with IFTTT
cons: The Spotter's performance is too inconsistent for us to feel comfortable relying upon for anything important
The lack of real-time status updates or an event history log within the app remains a major oversight

customer_reviews.title: THIS PRODUCT WILL NOT WORK WITH YOUR WINK HUB THUS IT IS USELESS!!
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE!!!!Wink doesn't support this product anymore!!! It's an orphan product that connects to nothing. But it and all you have is a fancy white hockey puck!!! So I'm clear: THIS PRODUCT WILL NOT WORK WITH YOUR WINK HUB THUS IT IS USELESS!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Less than 50% functionality.
customer_reviews.text: Temperature and humidity work, but motion, light, and sound don't - even when it's plugged in. Setting it up also seems to have stopped the Wink app from using my Nest as another sensor (I'd been using the Nest as a sensor, and that worked pretty well for temp. and humidity; I got this to help tell me when the Nest failed). At least temperature alerts, which is what I got it for, do work. It was also pretty tricky to figure out how to open it up to remove the batteries to get it to reset and go into setup mode. Like all Wink stuff, they don't really believe in instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T. Simchak

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, horrible product
customer_reviews.text: Really, this thing is a POC. It lasts maybe a week on batteries if you are lucky. The bottom plate takes quite a bit of fiddling to get on. When on battery, half the sensors don't work. Even when plugged in, it is unreliable. But the worst part has to be the Wink app. It is very basic and cumbersome to set up. If I want to use it for something, I have to program the minutest details of that function to get it to do what I want, rather than say choosing from a menu of use cases that have all the different alert levels configured.
customer_reviews.author: HIpSavvy

customer_reviews.title: no support for this old device, dont waste your time
customer_reviews.text: no longer supported by anyone, ods are that anyone you will purchase will be wore out
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: They Named it Right "Quirky"
customer_reviews.text: As far as I'm concerned they named this right "Quirky" It has it's uses but at best they're minimal. No way to set temperature which is inaccurate, much too sensitive for vibration, light and sound and no way to control it. It's since been replaced by a new model but this one was not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Seawind

customer_reviews.title: Quirky is indeed Quirky
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, but not quite ready for prime time. The sensor (named Quirky) lives up to it's name... it's quirky. Sometimes it captures the data, but most of the time it misses the events I'm interested in observing. The setup method is pretty cool, but the Wink mobile app also has a difficult color scheme.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Smith

customer_reviews.title: "quirky" updates to sensor readings...
customer_reviews.text: This sensors readings don't update on call and don't update with a schedule that follows any predictable logic that i've discovered. But, it's useful enough to use as a trigger for other quirky devices or IFTTT events
customer_reviews.author: babo3030

customer_reviews.title: Based on the product execution, I see no value to this device
customer_reviews.text: I get the concept but this device does not work to expectation (or come close) and when running on batteries alone, it loses half of it's capability. Can I return this please? It is actually worthless!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Pace

customer_reviews.title: The Quirky Spotter is no longer supported by Wink.
customer_reviews.text: The Quirky Spotter is no longer supported by Wink. You cannot pair this device to a Wink Hub.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Poorly implemented sensor from Wink - off by +/- 10 degrees
customer_reviews.text: A poor implementation of a senor from Wink. It's not accurate at all in regard to temperature (off by 10 or more degrees).
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: I liked them but stopped being supported and couldn't program them ...
customer_reviews.text: I liked them but stopped being supported and couldn't program them to my new phone cause the software is not available for that device.
customer_reviews.author: Jess h bishop

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected, wasted money
customer_reviews.text: I thought after reading the reviews that people just didn't know. But the truth is its a pain and doesn't work at all. My washer/dry did not make this thing react so I moved it to my door and had the same problem. I am not happy.
customer_reviews.author: ohhimark

customer_reviews.title: There are alternatives out there that are not only better but also outstanding
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could get my money back. This item is worthless. I could not get any of the features to work with this device. it was poorly designed and does not work as stated. I would not even encourage anyone to buy the second generation even if the company comes out with one. There are alternatives out there that are not only better but also outstanding. Don't waste your money in this one.
customer_reviews.author: Loubert Michel

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money...
customer_reviews.text: Light sensor doesn't work. It doesn't sense motion, it senses vibration. Some functions don't work while it's on battery power. Basically useless for anything I need.
customer_reviews.author: Brian W Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Not Again
customer_reviews.text: Only readingS I get are temp and humidity and even they aren't accurate. Don't waist your money.
customer_reviews.author: Veger5

customer_reviews.title: The quirky spotter is a great concept but I think there is a lot of ...
customer_reviews.text: The quirky spotter is a great concept but I think there is a lot of ground to be covered. This is a good start. Set up was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: M. O

customer_reviews.title: This product is a great idea, however
customer_reviews.text: This product is a great idea, however, the idea stops there. The implementation is poor and you do need to plug it in to power in order to use all the sensors! I bought two for testing and feel like I was sold on the marketing and the product could never deliver what it says on the box. DO NO BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Mcflied

customer_reviews.title: Wait to purchase the Generation 2 unit.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure your purchasing the second generation units.Version 2 unit.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Dave

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Received a used unit that would not even turn on
customer_reviews.author: RDouglas

customer_reviews.title: And the sound detection is quick too better than a IR detector
customer_reviews.text: Works incredibly well. Tip, setup the spotter near the WIFI access spot when setting up the Spotter and then move to your intended location to monitor. The Temperature and Humidity measurements are worth the price of the spotter alone. The Light sensor is quick. And the sound detection is quick too better than a IR detector. Motion works well too. This product provides a lot environment monitoring bang for the buck. One needs to test and think about where to place it. It works very very well saving me thousands for monitoring devices. I bought 10 spotters.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Boutros

customer_reviews.title: Absolute junk... I feel ripped off. ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk... I feel ripped off... I am not a novice to these types of devices. I patiently dealt with the pairing process, but the sensors are completely inaccurate. Quirkey is more than quirky.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Conner

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to set up. Talked to Wink for help setting up with no avail. Seller was great with return.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Rachel Leahy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm still finding ways to use this incredible piece of technology!
customer_reviews.author: Maineiac

customer_reviews.title: Too much in one package.
customer_reviews.text: It does too much in one package. I think they would be better off just parting out the sensors (like having a small light sensor). There aren't many applications were you would need to know the temperature, light level, vibrations, and humidity in one spot.
customer_reviews.author: John Carson

customer_reviews.title: QUIRKY is my name...
customer_reviews.text: Time for WINK to step it up. These Wink products remind me of my first Apple IIe computer. They need to be more compatible with many more products. Like the Sony Betamax / VCR, the market is not big enough for multiple players. Find a common platform and focus on better products and features.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Fair

customer_reviews.title: can't get it to work
customer_reviews.text: I have a general rule that if I can't make this sort of thing work in 3/4 hour, I pitch it or, if its more important, hire a professional. I have decided to pitch this.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great both with the Wink hub and IFTTT. Looking forward to more triggers in IFTTT.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Inman

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, terrible setup that never worked!
customer_reviews.text: Not recommended. Terrible setup with flashing lights, that never worked. Tried many times & called customer support. Do not buy. Needs a new design for setup / installation.
customer_reviews.author: Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: BAD SELLER!
customer_reviews.text: item is NOT "open box", it is old and used. Also, missing parts.
customer_reviews.author: Earles

customer_reviews.title: Know how the house is doing when you are away!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted for my Father-in-Law! It is perfect for when her visits for three months and wants to know how his house is doing.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Kroll

customer_reviews.title: Sweeet
customer_reviews.text: Works super well - 4 star rating only because you need to use AC adapter for all 5 sensors to work - AA batts only run some of the sensors. When it's running, works great witht he app and other smart devices.....especially if you use IFTTT
customer_reviews.author: Villas

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my use.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of users with out of the box use. For me it works just find with [...] I will even order another for use on the fridge door.
customer_reviews.author: C. Oliver

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS SPOTTER!!! I had ...
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS SPOTTER !!! I had two of these working for a while with my Wink Hub, but recently as the company "Quirky" files bankruptcy, they stopped supporting these product and Wink Hub doe not recognize these any more - basically my $100/- became glorified paper weights...
customer_reviews.author: Sunny M.

customer_reviews.title: GE doesn't want your business.
customer_reviews.text: No longer supported even, even though it's specifically built by GE for wink, even with the original wink Hub that it worked with previously. This alone is enough reason to steer me away from wink for future automation. I could understand it not working with newer hubs, but there is no reason they should see support for the original Hardware platform comma for a perfectly good since sensor.
customer_reviews.author: rainabba

customer_reviews.title: I don't know why Amazon is still allowing people to ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why Amazon is still allowing people to sell this product, wink no longer supports this product. It will not connect to your wine club and they no longer allow it on the ecosystem. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a while ago. I decided to keep them since the temperature sensor was working and I got them really cheap anyway. The light sensor barely works but the rest seem to work most of the time. For some reason these spotters flood my router with DHCP requests. The second version is around the corner so I would say buy it only if you get them really cheap, otherwise don't pay full price for this. I use them on my room to turn on/off the switch for the fan depending on the temperature. Note that the temperature seems to be off by about 10 degrees or so but as long as you know that it should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: HC

customer_reviews.title: No Longer Compatible With Wink Hub
customer_reviews.text: I have two of the Version 1 Spotters, which is the one in the product photo. Wink had confirmed that it no longer communicates with their hub, and because Quirky, the Spotter's manufacturer, is out of business, there are no plans of updating the firmware to be compatible. I would advise folks not to purchase this product unless Quirky is bought out or sell the products to another manufacturer who can continue Wink support and compatibility.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: Does not even serve as a paper weight
customer_reviews.text: This does not even serve as a paper weight, just tried to call tech support using the number given by app (on google play) Steve transferred (said he could not help) me to Crystal then call went to voice mail. The documentation for this device is nonexistent‎. I found  that gives you more than what was included in the box which was a brief 4 steps of how to connect your device. Nowhere does it say how to remove the cover to access the batteries or how to power on/off the device. I spent over an hour trying to setup this device on a wpa2 network. If you could give negative stars this would get it.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Cannot get Wink to Blink
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these last week on clearance @ the Red Spot. Price was $4.95 each. The reason? No longer manufactured; probably because of all the problems buyers had with them. Since these are Compatible with the Echo, I bought them. I opened one and tried to connect it to the Wink app, but after seven tries and seven failures, I'm giving it a break. I'll update this review if I ever get it running.
customer_reviews.author: Koren55

customer_reviews.title: Garbage...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is simply terrible! It doesn't do anything consistently other than not operate correctly. The alerts are haphazard at best and they seem to stop working completely once the thing goes to "sleep"... if that's what its actually doing since the documentation is so lacking one cannot accurately discern what its doing or not doing. Mr. Quirky should be shot (no, not literally, of course) and GE should be ashamed of themselves for manufacturing garbage. But then again, GE manufactures a lot of garbage... I know because I once worked for them. Save your money and have a couple of drinks instead (I'm heading to Ziggy's for a drink in a few minutes!).
customer_reviews.author: Gene K.

customer_reviews.title: Quirky Quirky
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars due to painful setup. I use this to monitor my apartment (and cat) while I'm on vacation. It gives an extra (albiet simple) level of security. Beware some features don't work when the unit isn't plugged in to an outlet. ONLY humidity and temperature sensors work on battery power. If you are having problems syncing to your phone, try the following: 1) Use a dark room when trying to sync with the flashing screen. Throwing a blanket or shirt over your phone and the unit helps GREATLY. 2) Remove your phone cover when syncing. 3) Sit your phone directly on top of the unit when you start the sequence. Just be careful, as it vibrates when finished.
customer_reviews.author: Tourniquet

customer_reviews.title: How to hack unsupported device to work again?
customer_reviews.text: Spotter is no longer supported, but pre existing owners that also have quirky power strips can set it up as a new power strip and it will show as a spotter in the wink app. (Thanks to a Reddit user for this solution, saved me from owning a paperweight).
customer_reviews.author: TubaMamma

customer_reviews.title: Not a motion sensor
customer_reviews.text: Not what is seems! Despite 30 minutes to connect this device, the device is not what it seems. 1. The motion is only if the unit is shaken 2. The temp features will only launch triggers and not report to your phone 3.The sound only sometimes launches triggers For the cost of this unit, I would stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Geno

customer_reviews.title: save your money
customer_reviews.text: Its unfortunate that the device is so mediocre. It has promise, and the engineers may improve it over time, but if you are expecting to get something that works, you will be sorely disappointed. I am shocked that GE would put its name anywhere near this hockey puck. If you want to tinker, you are probably better off going with TWINE. If you want temperature and humidity sensing, there are a variety of options that will likely work far better. Sure, they may be more costly, but they also will work. If you are still even considering purchasing this device, take a look at the forums on quirky for more stories from other dissatisfied customers [...]
customer_reviews.author: G. Heller

customer_reviews.title: No Longer Supported!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS. In July 2016 Wink dropped support for this device (without warning). It no longer works now that the mfg has abandoned it.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Quirky = does not work.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product a chance thinking that 1 year later the bugs would be worked out. Still not. Unit is unresponsive and unreliable. The wink app does not offer diagnostic or trouble shooting tools either. This product and all products from this company are quirky to say the least. What a waste of time. Someone should file an FTC complaint against these people. Why would Amazon and Home Depot still be offering and even promoting these products.
customer_reviews.author: Scott J

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the worst tech product I have purchased in a long time. Other than the decent packaging, I wasted 4 hours trying to get it to work as advertised only to have it perform very sporadically without apparent cause. I have also lost all interest in Quirky based on their customer service, and/or lack thereof.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Product is terrible. Bought one and it would not work
customer_reviews.text: Product is terrible. Bought one and it would not work. Sent an email to customer service 5 days ago and still not response. Product was showing on battery power even though I had it plugged in. Why does this matter? Full functionality, temperature and movement monitor only work if plugged in. When I received no response I returned it and bought a second one. Now the software isn't working right and I can't get it to sync with my system. I give up!
customer_reviews.author: James Weller

customer_reviews.title: Just Bad ... no wonder it is called "Quirky"
customer_reviews.text: Just Bad ... no wonder it is called "Quirky" I don't know where to start... I cannot believe that GE allowed their logo to be associated with this. The device is obviously still in Beta. Many functions do not work at all. The set up process is weird and just plain painful. The lack of documentation is baffling. I am shocked that Amazon is still listing it on their website. The Android software is buggy. This product is just plain atrocious. That's the only way to put it. It does not even deserve one star.
customer_reviews.author: Todd in Greensboro

customer_reviews.title: Quirky to set up and unreliable readings.
customer_reviews.text: Quirky to set up and unreliable readings. I agree with many other reviews. Seems product not ready for release. I tried two. One in a quiet basement alerts frequently for loud noise and one in area with more noise has never triggered for noise, even when sounds like a dog bark near it. Temperatures don't match room temps of other devices in same area, like a Nest and a Netatmo temp sensor. In short, cant confirm Spotter spots anything correctly
customer_reviews.author: Sting J

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust this thermometer.
customer_reviews.text: Thermometer reads 28 degrees, but two others read 39 degrees. That's unacceptable. Humidity and thermometer also only work when plugged in -- not on battery power. I should have read all the other reviews before purchasing this product. They are right. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but not ready for prime time - really a toy
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 - one worked for 4 months, the other worked for a week. Runs fine on battery but not AC power (not a failed transformer either) - which is required kind of required for any long term monitoring, like over a winter). If monitoring for freeze ups better off buying Wi-Fi enabled thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Brossi

customer_reviews.title: Works great if you don't plug the power cord into the headphone jack.
customer_reviews.text: They must have updated the firmware because mine works great. Honestly I hunk the major problem is he headphone jack is the same size as the power jack. The first time I plugged it in, I put it in the wrong jack. When you do this it runs off batteries and only light and motion works and it doesn't update as often. I really wish someone would tell me what the headphone jack is actually for? I think half of the bad reviews could have been avoid had they just put a rubber plug in the headphone jack so people would hook it up right.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah L Fish

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: WARNING! Do not buy! I have had a spotter monitoring my safe for several months. When it detected motion, light, or high humidity, I got an instant notification. Recently, I opened my safe, and my spotter failed to notify me of the motion and light. After troubleshooting for hours, I removed the spotter from my Wink app, and tried to re-install it. I got a message that said, "This product is out of production and no longer supported. Please return to the seller from whom it was purchased." A Google search revealed that Quirky has filed for bankruptcy and GE is claiming that Quirky has ruined their reputation. [...]
customer_reviews.author: webs

customer_reviews.title: Not the best product.
customer_reviews.text: I have four of these in my house. Not very accurate with temperature or humidity and the light and sound sensors are inconsistent. There is an updated version and I'm hoping these will be better.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Piech

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to Our Wine Cellar!
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised by all of the 1 star ratings. I bought this for my husband wine cellar and it has been absolutely on target. It sends an alert if the temp gets too high and lets him know when the door opens. It's actually saved his wine collection.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Hay

customer_reviews.title: Total junk. I bought three, none of them functioned properly. Wasted tons of time.
customer_reviews.text: This product is garbage, pure and simple. I bought three from Home Depot. None of them function as advertised. Only one of the three would connect to my network, but then the Wink program wouldn't recognize the one that did. Moreover, the online site would not recognize my log in and password after registering on my Android. Typical GE garbage: improperly tested, waste the consumers' time. Junk. Stay away. Far away.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Sad, I really wanted this to work. Just couldn't get it to link to my wink hub (which is also an exercise in patience) so I returned it. Looks like they have a version 2 of this coming out soon, so wait for that if you want one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Herman Deville

customer_reviews.title: A truly quirky device
customer_reviews.text: Headed back to seller... Ac power did not work out of the box. The motion and light sensors seemed to be random - I got a notice that the device moved and then later got another one - even though it was sitting on the counter. The light sensor seemed to be squirrelly as well. You need the ad for the temp and humidity - so was unable to test those. It's a great idea though - just needs to work out of the box...
customer_reviews.author: Billie Armendarez

customer_reviews.title: Device would never pair up and had to throw it away. Wink hub had firmware date problems and had to throw it away also.
customer_reviews.text: This device would never pair up with the Wink hub. I am amazed some big names like GE and Home Depot sell this Wink technology because I can't believe they want their customers to have such a bad experience.
customer_reviews.author: Echosonic

customer_reviews.title: Price is way to high for something that barely works...
customer_reviews.text: Works most of the time but WAY to expensive for what it does, should be around $10 considering it's lack of functionality and reliability....
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J Packwood

customer_reviews.title: Not true motion detector!  Uses an accelerometer to detect motion of it's self,  not motion around it.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this, could not get motion detection to work until I found it uses an accelerometer to detect motion and not IR, pretty much pointless. I'm rather sure I'm going to return the two I bought and wait for a true motion detector.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Myers

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised - just follow the instructions
customer_reviews.text: Had it working in 10 minutes with no problems - a good solution at a low price. It would be hard to replicate the functionality without spending a lot more and taking up a lot more space - cool technology - thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Traveller

customer_reviews.title: Wait for something else. Even if you are an early adopter of technology. This is junk.
customer_reviews.text: I have not successfully been able to connect this to my network. Managed to follow some instructions to reset it but it is largely a paper weight. Thought that it would be a nice addition to the Wink hub despite the negative reviews. Definitely regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MikeGroovy

customer_reviews.title: Tricky to program, needs to be reset right out ...
customer_reviews.text: Tricky to program, needs to be reset right out of the box. Light sensor only works well with incandescent bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: M Sard

customer_reviews.title: Looks pretty but doesn't do much.
customer_reviews.text: Sensor did not detect motion when I was shaking it, also sound and light sensors do not work. Was not able to find a way to switch Temp to Fahrenheit on Android. Not sure what this is for until they improve the sensors.
customer_reviews.author: rjbastian

customer_reviews.title: This item never worked fro the beginning. Just would ...
customer_reviews.text: This item never worked fro the beginning. Just would not connect with my phone. Would have cost more to send back hence I did not bother
customer_reviews.author: Cedric B. Celestine

customer_reviews.title: this is SPOTTER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Man...... This device sucks. SUCKSSSSS. Horrific setup when attempting to connect it the IPhone. I had to lay my phone on top if the spotter to connect then wait for this piece of garbage to connect. Thankfully my phone didn't fall and break when it vibrated to let you know it's connected. Once connected it's all down hill. The motion sensor sucks because it's only vibration. That's not a motion sensor it's a FREAKIN SHOCK SENSOR!!!! Stevie wonder can detect light faster than this piece of garbage. Worst device ever right next to leap motion and the vizio streaming box.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Barringer

customer_reviews.title: Wait for another model!
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase this item, it is in accurate and unreliable with major connectivity issues. The idea is there, and will be useful once the bugs get worked out however, this model still has a lot of bugs what will frustrate you.
customer_reviews.author: J. T.

customer_reviews.title: All the 1 star reviews are true this is great idea but very poor execution
customer_reviews.text: DON'T BUY IT DOESN'T WORK . All the 1 star reviews are true this is great idea but very poor execution .
customer_reviews.author: MARCIN KASINSKI

product_meta.title: Quirky PSPT1-WH01 Wink Spotter Electronic Reference Device
product_meta.description: Spotter keeps you updated on what's going on at home-from anywhere. Monitor motion, sound, light, temperature, and humidity all from your mobile device. Use Spotter as a veritable extension of your senses, for anything from baby monitoring to washer/dryer notifications or perfecting your wine cellar; the possibilities are endless.
feature_bullets: Spotter lets you monitor motion, sound, light, temperature, and humidity from your smartphone. Home is where the heart is; it's nice to have eyes and ears there too
The idea might seem high-tech at first, but Spotter is friendly and intuitive. Choose from common uses or come up with new ways Spotter can assist you. The future is now!
Smart products become more efficient (and fun!) when connected wirelessly to your mobile device. They free up time to focus on what you want to, not what you have to

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.4 out of 5 stars115 ratings2.4 out of 5 stars
